snippet: The unpredictable prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, who has called for a new election, may represent the best hope for guiding Greece to stability.
abstract: European leaders who formerly scorned Greek Prime Min Alexis Tsipras may end up rooting for the leftist leader in upcoming election he has called to seek mandate for latest bailout program; many now regard Tsipras as Greece's best hope for stability at this time.

byline.contributor: Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting from Athens, Victor Homola from Berlin, and Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome.

lead_paragraph: The unpredictable prime minister, Alexis Tsipras, who has called for a new election, may represent the best hope for guiding Greece to stability.

headline.main: In a Twist, Europe May Find Itself Relying on Success of Alexis Tsipras of Greece
headline.print_headline: In a Twist, Europeans May Find Themselves Rooting for Greece’s Leader
